001    package ca.hullabaloo.util.cache;
002    
003    import java.lang.ref.SoftReference;
004    
005    /**
006     * Implements a Cache.Entry that holds its data as a soft reference.
007     * 
008     * @author Darren Gilroy
009     */
010    public class SoftCacheEntry extends DefaultCacheEntry implements Cache.Entry {
011            /**
012             * Creates a new SoftCacheEntry object.
013             * 
014             * @param key
015             *            This object's key
016             */
017            public SoftCacheEntry(Object key) {
018                    super(key);
019            }
020    
021            /**
022             * Creates a new SoftCacheEntry object.
023             * 
024             * @param key
025             *            This object's key
026             * @param value
027             *            the initial value
028             */
029            public SoftCacheEntry(Object key, Object value) {
030                    super(key);
031                    setValue(value);
032            }
033    
034            /**
035             * Sets the value.
036             * 
037             * @param val
038             *            the new value (stored as a soft reference)
039             */
040            public void setValue(Object val) {
041                    super.setValue(new SoftReference<Object>(val));
042            }
043    
044            /**
045             * Since the values are held as SoftReferences, the value may return NULL.
046             * 
047             * @see Cache.Entry#value()
048             */
049            public Object value() {
050                    SoftReference val = (SoftReference) super.value();
051    
052                    return (val == null) ? null : val.get();
053            }
054    }
